article.headline: Portland State 74, Portland 55
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Blake Walker and Antone Jarrell each scored 20 points as Portland State defeated the University of Portland 74-55 on Friday night at Portland State. Seamus Boxley added 13 points and 10 rebounds for the Vikings (4-5), who snapped a three-game losing streak to the Pilots. Donald Wilson led Portland (5-4) with 13 points while Adam Quick added 10 points. Portland State shot a blistering 53 percent from the field and was 10-of-19 from 3-point range. The Pilots struggled all night offensively and connected on just 16 of 48 shots (33 percent). After leading 35-22 at halftime, the Vikings came out of the locker room and put together a 15-3 run to start the second half to go up 50-25 with 15 minutes left to play. The Pilots got no closer than 15 point the rest of the way. Portland State scored the first five points of the game and jumped out to a 17-5 lead midway through the first half after Walker hit a jumper from the free throw line. Jarrell, who connected on four of PSU's six 3-pointers in the half, sparked a late 15-7 first-half run and helped the Vikings take a 35-22 lead at the break.
